intro: Ouratea fieldingiana, commonly known as the Florida ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in hardwood hammocks and wetlands.
